item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, April 14, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Zig's new LinkedList API (it's time to learn fieldParentPtr) (109 points | 71 comments)
2. Kezurou-Kai #39 (180 points | 10 comments)
3. Hacktical C: practical hacker's guide to the C programming language (62 points | 23 comments)
4. Omnom: Self-hosted bookmarking with searchable, wysiwyg snapshots [showcase] (49 points | 19 comments)
5. Meilisearch – search engine API bringing AI-powered hybrid search (10 points | 3 comments)
6. SSH Keys Don't Scale. SSH Certificates Do (12 points | discuss)
7. The Ford Executive Who Kept Score of Colleagues' Verbal Flubs (47 points | 31 comments)
8. Everything wrong with MCP (322 points | 138 comments)
9. Open guide to equity compensation (511 points | 223 comments)
10. Mario Vargas Llosa has died (135 points | 23 comments)
11. Show HN: Resurrecting Infocom's Unix Z-Machine with Cosmopolitan (115 points | 25 comments)
12. I built an app to organize Kindle highlights (and physical book quotes too) (8 points | 3 comments)
13. Albert Einstein's theory of relativity in words of four letters or less (1999) (185 points | 96 comments)
14. Show HN: I made a free tool that analyzes SEC filings and posts detailed reports (211 points | 60 comments)
15. New Vulnerability in GitHub Copilot, Cursor: Hackers Can Weaponize Code Agents (132 points | 72 comments)
16. Googler... ex-Googler (651 points | 484 comments)
17. NoProp: Training neural networks without back-propagation or forward-propagation (125 points | 30 comments)
18. Why Everything in the Universe Turns More Complex (106 points | 65 comments)
19. Writing Cursor rules with a Cursor rule (121 points | 37 comments)
20. Implementing DeepSeek R1's GRPO algorithm from scratch (156 points | 3 comments)
21. Transformer Lab (114 points | 9 comments)
22. Neutrinos' maximum possible mass shrinks further (63 points | 23 comments)
23. Why Fennel? (254 points | 117 comments)
24. Math 13 – An Introduction to Abstract Mathematics [pdf] (157 points | 9 comments)
25. Docker Model Runner (84 points | 27 comments)
26. Quick Primer on MCP Using Ollama and LangChain (109 points | 18 comments)
27. Comparing economic inequality between the Roman Empire and the Han Dynasty (58 points | 54 comments)
28. A 42,600-ton Chinese ship will drill 7 miles (ca. 11 km) under the ocean floor (3 points | discuss)
29. How much oranger do red orange bags make oranges look? (140 points | 80 comments)
30. One of the country's leading Alzheimer's projects is in jeopardy (6 points | discuss)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, April 14, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
